Weather conditions: Adverse weather conditions, such as heavy rain, extreme heat, or strong winds, can cause damage to the site or disrupt the dig.
Loss of key personnel: A key member of the team may leave the project, causing a disruption in the workflow and potentially delaying the project.
Differences in opinion: There may be disagreements among team members regarding the interpretation of artifacts or the direction of the dig.
Safety hazards: Unexpected hazards, such as unstable ground or hazardous materials, can pose risks to the safety of the team members.
Lack of proper equipment: Insufficient or inadequate equipment may hinder the progress of the dig and increase the risk of accidents or damage to the site.
